Quickstride puts a friendly arm around Windlord with a gentile look on his =
face.

" I definitely know how ya feel.  There's times when it was okay ta =
smash someone's snout in with a good, swift kick of my hind hooves, but not=
 now.  But things have a way of working out on their own.  Some call it kar=
ma.  What they do ta others, eventually comes back ta them.  And all we nee=
d ta do is sit back and let that happen.  Hydras is gonna get it big time. =
 I see it in Tucson Prime's face.  He means business and he won't give up t=
ill that miserable lizard is dealt with accordingly.  "

Perpetually on the=
 move and constantly busy. 

On Jul 1, 2011, at 2:26 AM, Airshadow Nightsta=
r <airly2002@...> wrote:

> Windlord:
>  
> =E2=80=9CI=E2=80=99m Re=
ally mad at Predacons what they have done us...  And mad at myself for all =
the  troubles that I tried to create for Rodimus and Nighlight, But the wor=
se of all is... I ENJOYED  TO DO ALL THAT CHAOS!! =E2=80=9Dsaid Windlord al=
most with despair =E2=80=9CThe sensasion to act without balance and restain=
 was... overhelming... And now it=E2=80=99s hard to for me to keep it in ch=
eck...  But I want to do something usefull with my rage and give the Preds =
a payback=E2=80=9D
>  
>  
> From: Sandy Panico
> Sent: Thursday, June 30, =
2011 5:53 PM
> To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: Re: Changing times (Cu=
e: All Maximals & Autobots)
>  
> 
> 
> Quickstride sighs, transforms and p=
uts a hand on his shoulder.
>  
> " It's okay ta be frustrated.  Things are=
 really nuts around here and tensions are at an all time high.  Even I'm ge=
tt'n effected by stress.  Well.. Put it this way, better ta have some venti=
lation when I'm around these days.  Any way, if something bothers ya it's b=
etter ta talk about it than keeping it inside.  Besides I got all day."
> 
=
> Perpetually on the move and constantly busy.
>

 stood in the doorway of the training room for a moment
>> watching WINDLOR=

>> what was going on in =
the mind of this maximal. There were dark corners
>> to him, and he was not=
 sure what it portended to.
>>

>> > off to find Windlo=
rd. He trots by the med bay then perks his ears up,
>> > following the sour=
ce of Windlord's footsteps until he clip clops into the

oking for cues and clues that would help
